pic24_dspic33::pwm

pic24_dspic33::pwm Class Reference

This class provides basic control of the pulse-width modulation peripheral for the PIC. More...

Detailed Description

This class provides basic control of the pulse-width modulation peripheral for the PIC.

Member Function Documentation

def pic24_dspic33::pwm::__init__ (   self,
  freq,
  isTimer2,
  oc,
  ocPin = -1 
)

Create the class instance for a PWM output.

Parameters:
freq Frequency at which the PWM will operate, in Hz.
isTimer2 True to use timer2, false to use timer3 for PWM.
oc Output compare module to use.
ocPin For remappable devices, the port P pin on which to map the PWM output. For non-remappable devices, this value must be < 0.
__NATIVE__
return configPwmPy(ppframe);

def pic24_dspic33::pwm::set (   self,
  ratio 
)

Set the duty cycle for a PWM output.

Parameters:
ratio The desired duty cycle, ranging from 0 (off completely) to 1 (maximum, 100% duty cycle).
__NATIVE__
return setPwmRatioPy(ppframe);

def pic24_dspic33::pwm::setCounts (   self,
  counts 
)

Set the duty cycle for a PWM output.

Parameters:
counts The number of PR2/3 counts which gives the on time of the PWM wave to generate.
__NATIVE__
return setPwmCountsPy(ppframe);
